meanings.definition: The act of making something void or null.
meanings.sent1: Her voidances of the contract caused a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer explained the legal voidances to the client.
meanings.sent3: The magician's voidances of the cards left the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The voidances of his promises left a trail of broken trust.
meanings.sent5: The voidances of the warranty made the product unreliable.

meanings.definition: The state of being empty or without contents.
meanings.sent1: The voidances of the room made it feel cold and lonely.
meanings.sent2: The voidances in the jar indicated it was empty.
meanings.sent3: The voidances of the fridge made her realize she needed to go grocery shopping.
meanings.sent4: The voidances of the treasure chest disappointed the pirates.
meanings.sent5: The voidances of the box revealed its hidden nature.
